name: Pool
description:
This is a very simple pool simulation for one or two players.

The playing screen consists of a red cue ball and 6 numbered red balls on a green background. In the top left of the screen is a blue power bar that cycles through 1 to 5 levels. The player uses the arrow keys to position a cursor, then presses S to shoot. If you don't pot anything after about half a dozen shots, then the game resets. There's no clever physics behind this game, balls don't seem to slow down as they move across the table, they move at a steady pace until they stop.

The points scored for each ball potted are calculated as 10 * the ball's number

shot.caption: This is the screen that's displayed when the game is loaded. Press 1, or 2, and you're taken straight into the game.
The game screen. The arrow keys move the cursor around the table. When it's in the right position you press 'S' to shoot. The blue power bar at the top left determines the power of the shot.
